Message.Title: LIAR LIAR PANTS ON FIRE !
Message.Msg: ROMNEY on the failure of Obama's economic policy: "And the proof of that is 23 million people out of work. The proof of that is 1 out of 6 people in poverty. The proof of that is we've gone from 32 million on food stamps to 47 million on food stamps. The proof of that is that 50 percent of college graduates this year can't find work." THE FACTS: The number of unemployed is 12.5 million, not 23 million. Romney was also counting 8 million people who are working part time but would like a full-time job and 2.6 million who have stopped looking for work, either because they are discouraged or because they are going back to school or for other reasons. He got the figure closer to right earlier in the debate, leaving out only the part-timers when he said the U.S. has "23 million people out of work or stopped looking for work." But he was wrong in asserting that Obama came into office "facing 23 million people out of work." At the start of Obama's presidency, 12 million were out of work. His claim that half of college graduates can't find work now also was problematic. A Northeastern University analysis for The Associated Press found that a one-fourth of recent graduates were probably unemployed and another quarter were underemployed, which means working in jobs that didn't make full use of their skills or experience.

Message.Title: WHY SURFANDSKI IS SAD.....
Message.Msg: he's not sad because Obama will lose and get tossed out, he's not sad because he's horse is losing this race....he's sad, understandably, because his ideas are old, tired, broken and deficient. The dreams of his youth have yellowed with age and are now peeling, broken and blotched. The idea that a powerful central government could solve problems, bring fairness, equity and justice to a system was ever his hope, ever his dream. It was always flawed, but the stupidity of youth hid those flaws. We now all see that the only hope for America is the American. The individual, the creativity of Jobs, the technical insight, the hubris of the American ingenue, the American creator, the mom and pop places, the corporate energy, all this provides the answers that Government cannot now nor ever could create. So Surfy is sad, as anyone would be at the fading of youth, and the hard reality of life. We on the other hand, rejoice at the glory that was once and will be again, the American century! Sweep the drooling Democrats back into the dustbin of history and get on with the business of morning in America

Message.Title: MORE MITT MYTHS
Message.Msg: The 12 lies that made mitt romney’s debate performance pure fiction -- google it -- lie #1: romney says his "five point plan" will lead the us to prosperity. the reality: independent analysts say it would actually hurt the economy, in both the short and long term. ----- lie #2: romney says his tax plan wouldn’t hurt the middle class. the reality: it would raise taxes on the middle class while cutting them for multimillionaires and billionaires. (tax policy center (non-partisan)) ----- lie #3: romney says he won't reduce taxes on the wealthy. the reality: in fact, that’s exactly what his plan would do. ----- lie #4: romney claims his tax plan isn’t like anything we’ve tried before. the reality: it’s the same trickle-down grift we’ve seen from cons for more than 30 years. ----- lie #5: romney swears his policies won’t affect current seniors’ social security. the reality: his tax plan would increase taxes paid by social security recipients. ----- lie #6: romney says his tax plan won’t cost $5 trillion. the reality: his plan has been scored as costing $5 trillion, by respected nonpartisan sources – and this $5 trillion would be *in addition to* the cost of extending the bush tax cuts indefinitely (which he also advocates). ----- lie #7: romney claims his plan won’t add to the deficit. the reality: his plan would add nearly $500 billion to the nation's credit card *each and every year* ----- lie #8: romney claims there are six^ studies that have called his plan revenue neutral. (^a few weeks ago, he claimed it was five) the reality: of the original five so-called "studies," two were just wsj editorials, while the three others were ideologically driven advocacy papers thinly disguised as "studies." (as nearly as i can tell, the new 6th so-called "study" mitt cites was a synopsis of one of the three prior advocacy briefs, summarized for inclusion in that same right-wing think-tank's monthly newsletter.) ----- lie #9: romney says his plan won’t cut education. the reality: if cuts were applied pro rata with education's current share of the budget, it would mean a cut to education of more than $115 billion over the next decade. (and in fact, romney has already said that *no* required cuts will be taken from the defense budget - quite to the contrary, he says he will *increase* defense spending by two trillion dollars - meaning that required cuts to other parts of the federal budget will have to be even deeper, in order to make up the difference.) ----- lie #10: romney claims his energy plan will make north america energy independent. the reality: did you believe sarah palin when she advocated the same policy in 2008? ----- lie #11: romney’s plan will “deal with" people with pre-existing conditions. reality: actually, this one might be technically true, assuming mitt was using the phrase "deal with" euphemistically (or more to the point, euthanistically). in fact, he would repeal obamacare and it’s protections for people with pre-existing conditions, putting them back at the mercy of insurance companies, who will continue to avoid them like the plague. ----- lie #12: romney claims he was a bipartisan governor. the reality: he barely made *any* attempt to work with democrats in the massachussetts legislature, whether to persuade them or to advocate for his positions. instead, he attempted to impose his will much as a corporate ceo deals with subordinate employees. this had a rather predictable effect, and mitt "got out of the kitchen" tout de suite, after a single 4-year term. (and btw, fyi, he and his staff took the computers when they left - very tidy, these republicons...)

Message.Title: Swing state polls rigged by media matters and here is the proof
Message.Msg: In Florida, for example, McLaughlin finds that the average of the last four elections produced a turnout of 37% Democrats and 38% Republicans. But here is the partisan distribution of the most recent Florida media polls: 9-26: CBS/NY Times = 36% Dem / 27% Rep 9-23: Wash Post = 35% Dem / 29% Rep So the media polls reflect a 9 point and six point Democratic edge even though the actual experience of the past four elections has been a 1 point Republican advantage. Things are no better in Ohio. Here, McLaughlin finds a 2 point Democratic edge in the past four elections (38% Dem, 36% Rep). But the media polls show vastly more Democrats and fewer Republicans in their samples: 9-26: CBS/NY Times = 35% Dem / 26% Rep 9-23: Wash Post = 35% Dem / 27% Rep 9-11: NBC/Wall St Journal = 38% Dem / 28% Rep Once again, the actual exit poll-measured vote in Ohio shows a 2 point Democratic edge, but the polls reflect Democratic advantages of 9 points, 8 points, and 10 points respectively. In Virginia, it's the same story. The last four elections have a combined 1 point Republican edge, 37-36. But the media polls show a big pro-Democratic bias: 10/2: Roanoke College = Dem 36% / Rep 27% 9/17: CBS/NYTimes = Dem 35% / Rep 26% 9/16: Washington Post = Dem 35% / Rep 24% 9/11: NBC/Wall St Journal = Dem 31% / Rep 26% So instead of showing a 1 point Republican edge, these media poll samples show Democratic advantages of 9,9,11, and 5. The correct conclusion to draw from all these polls is that Romney is comfortably ahead in Virginia and Florida while he holds a slight lead in Ohio. And, remember these polls are all pre-debate! Also, bear in mind that the undecided vote in all of these polls usually goes against the incumbent. That's the real story.

Message.Msg: In what can only be described as a miracle, the September federal government jobs report shows that over 456,000 people gained employment through the creation of only 114,000 new positions! Topic.Title: If workforce was the same size as when Obama inaugurated UE would be 11.4%

Message.Msg: #1 Today there are 88 million working age Americans that are not employed and that are not looking for employment. That is an all-time record high. #2 When Barack Obama was elected, the percentage of unemployed Americans that had been out of work for more than 52 weeks was less than 15%. Today, it is above 30%. #3 There are 1.2 million fewer jobs in America today than there were when Barack Obama was inaugurated. #4 When Barack Obama first took office, the number of “long-term unemployed workers” in the United States was approximately 2.6 million. Today, that number is sitting at 5.6 million. #5 The average duration of unemployment in the United States is hovering close to an all-time record high. #6 During the Obama administration, worker health insurance costs have risen by 23 percent. #7 Since Barack Obama has been president, the average price of a gallon of gasoline in the United States has increased by 90 percent. #8 Since Barack Obama has been president, home values in the United States have declined by another 13 percent. #9 Under Barack Obama, new home sales in the U.S. set a brand new all-time record low in 2009, they set a brand new all-time record low again in 2010, and they set a brand new all-time record low once again during 2011. #10 Since Barack Obama took office, the number of Americans living in poverty has risen by more than 6 million. #11 Since Barack Obama entered the White House, the number of Americans on food stamps has increased from 32 million to 46 million. #12 The amount of money that the federal government gives directly to Americans has increased by 32 percent since Barack Obama entered the White House. #13 According to the U.S. Census Bureau, the percentage of Americans living in “extreme poverty” is now sitting at an all-time high. #14 When Barack Obama first took office, an ounce of gold was going for about $850. Today an ounce of gold costs more than $1700 an ounce. #15 Since Barack Obama became president, the size of the U.S. national debt has increased by 44 percent. #16 During Barack Obama’s first two years in office, the U.S. government added more to the U.S. national debt than the first 100 U.S. Congresses combined. #17 During the Obama administration, the U.S. government has accumulated more debt than it did from the time that George Washington took office to the time that Bill Clinton took office. #18 The U.S. national debt has been increasing by an average of more than 4 billion dollars per day since the beginning of the Obama administration.

Message.Title: How Obama fudged the Unemployment numbers.
Message.Msg: Adding 114k jobs SHOULD have raised the UE rate to 8.2% Almost EVERY economist agrees with that. One reason Secretary of Labor Solis defended her numbers was an 86k upward revision in July and August numbers.........GUESS WHAT folks, the private sector was actually revised down 5k but the a 91k increase came from public sector hiring. REALLY, the government needs to hire 91,000 people?????? RIGHT. ADD to that the BLS added 600k workers, ALL PART TIME, to its methodology. WHO, in their right mind with 1.25% GDP thinks there was an additional 600,000 workers added somewhere. The most surprising part of all this, the Obama administration thinks they can get away with this OBVIOUS fudging of the numbers for political gain. Koolaid chuggers will continue to vote for their LIAR in CHIEF.
